TEXT02:
Dear,

The 2016 Volt is all new this year and we know you’re going to be as excited as we are about the technology powering this next-generation electric vehicle.

At the heart of the all-new 2016 Chevrolet Volt, is a modified high-voltage lithium-ion battery with an electric range that's nearly 30% greater than the previous model. In fact, Volt lets you drive up to 80 kms1 on pure electricity. Plus, the new high-efficient 1.5L 4-cylinder engine doesn't require premium gas, saving you even more at the pump.

Charging the new battery is intuitive and convenient. Using GPS technology, it lets you customize your charge starts, to take advantage of off-peak energy hours. And on a 240-volt charging system, the battery can be fully charged in just 4.5 hours.

But the best part is, the all-new 2016 Volt makes driving simple and fun. The dual 8-inch diagonal LED colour displays include a customizable instrument panel and a centre stack display with pinch and zoom capability and the Chevrolet MyLinkTM system for the ultimate connected experience. Plus, the available OnStar 4G LTE Wi-Fi2 allows you to connect up to 7 devices3–so you’re never out of touch.

All this, and we’re just getting started. See everything the all-new 2016 Chevrolet Volt has to offer. Available Fall 2015. Starting at $40,090, includes freight and air tax.

Join the conversation: #NextGenVolt

TEXT14:
You are receiving this email advertisement because you expressed interest in Chevrolet.

1 Preliminary estimate based on GM testing. Assumes a fully-charged battery. Your actual driving range will vary based on conditions.

2 Visit onstar.ca for coverage maps, details and system limitations. Services and connectivity may vary by model and conditions. OnStar with 4G LTE connectivity is available on select vehicle models and in select markets. Customers will be able to access OnStar services only if they accept the OnStar User Terms and Privacy Statement (including software terms). OnStar acts as a link to existing emergency service providers. After the trial period (if applicable), an active OnStar service plan is required.

3Devices must be WPA2 compliant with active OnStar service and data plan. Wi-Fi devices manufactured prior to 2006 may not be compatible. Please consult your device manufacturer for information regarding the WPA2 security protocol and Wi-Fi device compatibility. Vehicle must be started or in accessory mode to access Wi-Fi. Visit onstar.ca for system details and limitations.
